pros: I like the teamwork and sense of family among the staff.
cons: Usual problem from all over the world. Staffing.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Nashville, TN
pros: Family-like atmosphere amongst coworkers, from housekeeping to the C-suite. Very culturally diverse atmosphere.
cons: Lots of sub-par equipment that consistently breaks down, countless ungrateful patients who consistently visit the hospital (sometimes for no apparent reason). DISORGANIZED!!! Mandatory overtime for full time staff that doesn't have an endpoint.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Nashville, TN
pros: Patient population is what many would consider difficult, but in my experience 9 out of 10 patients were kind and courteous. Some management is truly passionate about helping the community. Staff is mainly supportive to each other; some units have more personality conflicts than others. Good benefits.
cons: Dangerous levels of resource shortages. Safety concerns; sometimes inadequate security. Very low pay. Pressure to work OT.

pros: The ER is such a fun, fast-paced place to work, and the team there is like family who supports and works together to help save lives.
cons: NGH ER, like all ERs, is fast-paced and can sometimes feel overwhelming and frustrating, especially with some of the non-compliant patients we see as frequent flyers.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) in Nashville, TN
pros: Quite hospital and manager is helpful with employer

cons: I don’t have anything at this time.

pros: Work family, small hospital, everyone knows everyone
cons: Pay, short staffing, CEO should look after his employees more

pros: My coworkers are like a family.  We are a team working together to provide the best care possible for all patients.  It is very rewarding  to work in a hospital that treats every patient the same, whether they have commercial insurance or no insurance at all, they are why we are here.
cons: The only downside is that is that you have no control over the amount the city will fund to keep the hospital open and providing care, so you have to be conservative in all things possible.  Sometimes we can't purchase the latest upgrades due to cost, but we are a great team and somehow make it work for the best interest of the patient.

pros: They have really great chicken pot pie 😂I can't say much else about them except I will never work for them again!
cons: Everyone if "authority" blames everyone else for mistakes that THEY made, they never admit when they are wrong and make unethical choices.. Unsterile and lacks funding and knowledge of what actually needs to be done. Check out the 11th floor with all its new digs in. Thats where your tax payer money is going.. Reverse discrimination was a constant wonder..

review_title: Nurse Practitioner seeking job and knowledge grow to serve the people of my community and promote wellness.
pros: Metro General Hospital service an array of people that make up the Greater Nashville area; this helps make one appreciates cultural diversity.
cons: In healthcare, we do not settle for draw backs and downsides. Our focus is to heal and achieve positive outcomes for our clients even when monies are not allocated

pros: Helping people who really needed it.  Loved helping patients and employees who wanted it.
cons: People in management with wrong skill set, no accountability.  Work the people who are willing while allowing others to slide by.

pros: The population we provide care for.
the people that I worked with and around I enjoyed working with them and around them
cons: I had a problem with the management style there. They were very tunnel focused. The lack of training as well

pros: Physicians are wonderful. Nurses learn from their teaching.
cons: Manager is horrible. A few mean nurses that management supports 100%.

pros: The staff was wonderful and worked as a team.
cons: Upper management is worthless and only look out for themselves.
Direction of the hospital seems to always be questionable.
